title.narrative: 3.2 EARLY LEARNING-QUALITY AND COVERAGE

description.narrative: 3.2 Government and communities are better positioned to improve the coverage and quality of early learning and development., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more children have improved and meaningful learning outcomes

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.2 Government and communities are better positioned to improve the coverage and quality of early learning and development.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF supported the MBSSE to strengthen and improve the coverage and quality of early childhood development (ECD) through the construction of 30 ECD centres that provided access to quality play-based learning and early stimulation opportunities to 1,921 children (924 boys; 997 girls) and provided training to 1,139 ECD teachers (82 per cent female). UNICEF supported the government’s validation of the Integrated Early Childhood Development (IECD) policy and finalization of preprimary inputs into the Education Sector Plan 2022- 2026. UNICEF also provided developmentally appropriate materials which enhanced early learning environment for 22,303 children (boys 10,263, girls 12,040) children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
